title: Box Office: ‘Black Phone 2’ Dials It in for Blumhouse With $27.3M U.S. Opening and $43M Globally
summary: Elsewhere, Aziz Ansari's R-rated comedy 'Good Fortune,' starring Seth Rogen and Keanu Reeves, didn't find any gold, while holdover 'Tron: Ares' officially landed in bomb territory.

title: Ecuador’s Declining Oil Output Threatens to Spark an Economic Crisis
summary: The last decade has been especially grueling for Ecuador’s economically vital oil industry. Plummeting investment, heavily corroded infrastructure, endemic corruption, violent protests, severe oil spills and rising insecurity are all weighing on operations. title: Republicans Declare ‘Coal Week’ as Fossil-Fuel Agenda Goes into Overdrive
summary: Republican lawmakers on Monday moved to declare Coal Week, amplifying the Trump administration’s push to expand U.S. coal output and keep aging plants online, the Washington Times reported. The resolution coincides with new executive actions to “reinvigorate” coal, including directives signed in Ap…

title: E-Waste Per Capita: Europe Leads the World
summary: Every person in the world generates on average around 8 kilograms of electronic waste per year worldwide. However, there are significant regional differences. title: What’s Driving the Fall in US EV Adoption?
summary: In 2017, the CEO of General Motors, Mary Barra, committed the automaker to zero emissions by 2030. “No more gas. No more diesel. No more carbon emissions,” she wrote at the time. title: Oil Prices Sink as Tanker Traffic Highlights Supply Surge
summary: The volumes of oil in transit at sea continue to increase to multi-year highs as supply grows from both OPEC+ and non-OPEC+ exporters, and more long-haul voyages from the Atlantic to the Pacific basin are being made due to favorable arbitrage economics.
